img.alt: Click the Link for the Latest Updates Regarding COVID-19 and the Norwood Public Schools

div.div: Click the Link for the Latest Updates Regarding COVID-19 and the Norwood Public Schools

h5.a: Norwood Public Schools Closed for the Remainder of the Academic School Year

div.p: Per order of Governor Charlie Baker, all Massachusetts schools will be closed for the rest of the academic school year. Remote learning will continue in the Norwood Public Schools. Please click the headline to read Superintendent David Thomson's press release regarding the closure.

Budget information for the 2020-2021 fiscal year has been updated in the budget section of the school committee website. Click on the link to review the budget presentation and FY '21 budget information.

h5.a: Letter from DESE Associate Commissioner for Families of Special Education Students

div.p: Please click on the headline for a letter from the Massacgusetts Associate Commissioner of Elementary and Secondary Education with an update for families of special education students.

h5.a: Impact Norwood Releases Resource Toolkit for Coping With COVID-19

div.p: Impact Norwood has compiled and released a toolkit of resources for coping with stress and anxiety around COVID-19. Please click on the link to go the Impact Norwood resource page to download the toolkit.

h5.a: The Town of Norwood and the Norwood Public Schools Offering Free Grab & Go Dinner Meals at Selected Sites

div.p: The Town of Norwood in partnership with Norwood Food Service will be providing FREE Grab & Go dinner meals at selected sites. These meals will be provided to all requesting Norwood families and will be available for pick up from any of the community elementary schools on Wednesdays. All meals will be prepared and packaged "family style" and will be distributed cold. Heating & cooling instructions will be provided. These meals will contain 8-10 servings so they may last more than one day. The responses will be kept confidential and will be used for planning purposes only. Click on the headline to fill out the form and request a meal.

h5.a: Grab and Go Meals Being Provided by the Norwood Public Schools - Click here for the Menu!

div.p: The Norwood Public Schools Food Services Department is providing grab and go meals to anyone under the age of 18. Meals can be picked up Monday through Friday between 11:00 AM and 1:00 PM at the Balch, Callahan, Cleveland, Oldham and Prescott schools. Click on the headline for the menu!

h5.a: School Committee Budget Sub Committee Meeting - REMOTE MEETING ONLINE
School Committee Meeting - at Cleveland Elementary School
Professional Development Day - 1/2 day - AM Session Only
